intro: Cynanchum steppicola, commonly known as the steppe milkvetch, is a perennial herb native to the steppes of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae, which includes milkweeds, and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by distinctive, ribbed seed pods. It thrives in dry, open habitats and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions. Cynanchum steppicola is often found in grasslands and semi-desert regions, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
